sentences.en: For five years she was marooned in the Tigers'northern fief.
sentences.cn: 在猛虎组织的北部据点,她被拘禁了长达五年之久.

sentences.en: New Orleans now has one elected tax assessor - instead of seven, each overseeing his own fief.
sentences.cn: 新奥尔良现在有一位民选的税务稽核员, 而非再是七位各管一摊.

sentences.en: The heir on taking up his ancestors fief had to pay a relief.
sentences.cn: 继承其前辈封地的人须交纳一笔“接替费”.

trans.tran_en: In former times, a fief was a piece of land given to someone by their lord, to whom they had a duty to provide particular services in return
